entry.title: Re: 50 measurement documents are displayed from IE02/IE03
entry.content:
• In transactions such as IK17, parameter selcount 'No. of MeasDocs by MeasPoint' is by default 50 (selection-screen definition)
  • There is a similar default logic in IL03 (in form FCODE_LDOL_F6) which is passed to IK17
  • But you could change this default value, in calling transaction, maintain a value for memory id SELCOUNT (Enhnancement, BAdI, Exit...)

entry.title: Re: Cost Component split in Professional Service Scenario...
entry.content:
Hello @Johannes_Wienho 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, you can fully break down the rate of an internal activity type, such as services or project work, into detailed cost components within Margin Analysis. SAP offers the Primary Cost Component Split feature specifically for this purpose.

Unlike traditional product costing, which relies on materials, BOMs, and routings, the Primary Cost Component Split enables detailed analysis of internal activities usually recorded as secondary cost elements. By configuring the following elements, you can achieve the necessary transparency.

  • Define a Cost Component Structure to specify and categorise the cost types relevant for your business, such as Employee Related Costs, Technical Infrastructure, and Licence Cost.
  • Create a splitting structure to explain how costs posted to secondary cost elements via activity allocations will be mapped to the underlying primary cost components, ensuring each activity’s cost composition is reported accurately.
  • Assign the Splitting Structure to your control area to enable it for all related activity postings.
  • Plan your activity rates based on cost components, enabling the system to allocate and report actual costs in Margin Analysis according to the defined standards breakdown.

  • Cost Planning with Cost Component Breakdown: When setting prices for your activity types, you need to determine not just the overall rate (€10) but also how this rate is divided among the main cost components.

When activity allocations are posted, SAP S/4HANA Cloud uses this configuration to report costs in Margin Analysis at the specified level of detail, enabling accurate profitability analysis for services and projects.

For additional official information, refer to SAP Help: Cost Components in S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 回复： 高级公司间销售和高级公司间库存转储 2208版本常见问题集锦
entry.content:
Hi,

我使用了5D2的业务场景，按照官方的配置文档，一个公司需要创建两个业务伙伴，一个代表公司，一个代表工厂。例如，公司A，就要创建业务伙伴A1代表公司，创建业务伙伴A2代表工厂；公司B，就要创建业务伙伴B1代表公司，创建业务伙伴B2代表工厂。

我创建了公司A对外的销售订单，由公司B交付，最终创建公司间客户发票时，发现公司B的客户对应是业务伙伴A2（代表工厂），而系统自动生成的公司A的供应商发票，供应商是业务伙伴B1（代表公司）。

我的问题是，为什么不是同时是使用代表公司或工厂的业务伙伴？是否可以只设置一个业务伙伴？

entry.title: Error while updating CashFlowAssignments of JournalEntries with Service Layer
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m trying to assign a Cash Flow Line Item to a Journal Entry line using Service Layer. My payload looks like this:

{
  "JournalEntryLines": [
    {
      "Line_ID": 0,
      "CashFlowAssignments": [
        {
          "PaymentMeans": "pmtBankTransfer",
          "CashFlowLineItemID": 63,
          "JDTLineId": 0
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

 

If there is already a record in OCFT (Cash Flow Transactions table), and I specify CashFlowAssignmentsID, the request works.

But when no record exists in OCFT yet, I get the following error:

{
  "error": {
    "code": -2028,
    "message": {
      "lang": "en-us",
      "value": "No matching records found (ODBC -2028)"
    }
  }
}

My question: How can I create a new CashFlowAssignments row for a Journal Entry line via Service Layer when no OCFT row exists yet?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Can a communication point act as a clarification point and as a normal exit point simultaneously?
entry.content:
Dear experts,

Is there a way to handle the scenario where on an MFS-controlled pallet conveyor system there is a communication point that acts as the clarification point, but there are also "normal" routings that go thru it, so it's also a normal exit point?

In our experience if a communication point is set up in customizing as a clarification point (because in e.g. 60% of the cases it's actually a clarification point), then when an HU arrives there that has no MFSERROR, and has a destination outside of the MFS-controlled conveyor system, then it gets stuck on the clarification point with only an inactive ('waiting') warehouse task. Of course this is due to the fact that the /SCWM/MFS_WT_DET FM doesn't bother creating an active task from LOSC because the CP is set up as a clarification point. But does this mean that this is a binary choice and so a CP can only act as either a clarification point, OR a conveyor exit point? Is there any standard customizing solution to this, or any way with a custom development to solve it?

Of course, we could set up two CPs for the same physical conveyor point (1 for the clarification point, and 1 for the exit point), but I'd rather avoid it if possible.

Thanks very much in advance!

 #EWM-MFS #Communication point

@Dominik_Tylczynski @florian_kuchta2  @Jrg_Michaelis

entry.title: Re: How to improve the performance of prepared statements...
entry.content:
Hi Michael,

jConnect 4 7.07 is old and most likely 15.x version.
jconn4.jar has been around for many years. It switched from 7.07 to 16.
It isn't released any longer though and jconn42.jar is released going forward.
This has JDBC 4.1 and 4.2 standards.
You can see the version with command:
java -jar jconn4.jar
java -jar jconn42.jar

For your question. Stored procedure are not affected by DYNAMIC_PREPARE=true.
This property is for prepared statements. This property will generate a stored procedure for each query.
Example:
select * from table where column1 = ?
Turns into
create proc dyn100 as select * from table where column1 = ?

This can affect performance as metadata and TDS is sent to generate this stored proc on the fly.
If you do not execute the same query multiple times during a connection this can be overhead that hurts performance.
This proc creation is every prepared statement and is regenerated every new connection. Connection pooling doesn't affect this and is still regenerated.
You may want to check if DYNAMIC_PREPARE=false helps. This was the old default in jconn3.jar.

Hope that helps,
Ryan

entry.title: Re: Error: Import Fixed Asset Master Data from Microsoft...
entry.content:
Hello all,

Thank you for your help to get this thing straight.

First of all, the fiscal year to import to should be the current year which is 2025 today.  I can't think of another scenario.

It's possible to import to the current year.  You should remove the date like this.

Número de artículoDescripción del artículoGrupo de artículosClase AFClase amortizaciónÁrea de valoraciónGrupo AFGrupo de amortizaciónVida útilResto vida útil
AF-000003Notebook PC130CAF-COMPUTOCA-COMPUTODEP_CONTABLECOMPUTOCEDIS4848

You should execute capitilization from the SAP menu manually.  So it won't help you much but will reduce your work somewhat when you have a large number of assets to register.

Normally you want to import existing assets that have been acquired in the past years.  You can put those dates as they happend, which are 20240818 and 20240901 in this example.

Número de artículoDescripción del artículoGrupo de artículosClase AFFecha capitalizaciónGrupo AFGrupo de amortizaciónNúmero de inventario del activoNúmero de serie de activoÁrea de valoraciónFecha apertura valoraciónVida útilResto vida útilClase amortizaciónCAPCantidad de activos
AF-000003Notebook PC130CAF-COMPUTO20240818COMPUTOCEDISKA0001HP0001DEP_CONTABLE202409014844CA-COMPUTO160001

The importing process automatically calculate capitalization until the current date according to the acquisition price, useful life, and remaining useful life.

The confusing part is that the remaining useful life, 44 in this example, should be the amount of months that remained at the beggining of the year no matter what date the current date is.  I import the data today, 20250902, but I should reduce four months that are from 202409 to 202412 where 20250101 is the first day of the current fiscal year.

In both cases, posting depreciation is a separate thing.  The importing process doesn't generate any posting to accounts.  You shoud take care of it manually.

Also, the document numbering belongs to "manual".  I wanted to count it up in a custom series of document number but I couldn't find a way.

For what it's worth, these are my findings.

Regards, Koichi

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud / Business Partner - Handling of Mul...
entry.content:
Dear @LukasKuhn 

Thank you for your detailed questions. Based on the information you provided, please find below some clarifications and recommendations.

Custom Address Usage Types

  • In the Public Cloud, it is not possible to create custom address usage types. Only the standard SAP-delivered usages such as standard, invoice, shipping and correspondence are available.
    • As an alternative, you may use custom fields in the Business Partner (via the Custom Fields and Logic app) to flag addresses with additional semantics.
    • Leverage these fields in forms or output determination for differentiating between addresses.

Country/Region vs. Language in Output

  • You are correct, the Business Partner Language field controls the output language (e.g., invoices).
  • The Country/Region field in addresses mainly impacts tax determination, formatting of addresses in forms and intrastat or legal reporting. It does not influence the output language.

The implication is, if a Business Partner has a German standard address and a US shipping address, the output will still follow the master data language setting. By default, there is no automatic switch to English based on the US address.

Here are options to enable you fulfil your requirement

To address your scenario, you have two possible approaches:

First is to maintain Separate Business Partners

    • Create one BP with language = DE and another with language = EN.
    • Link them to the same corporate group using customer hierarchies.
    • This ensures invoices are generated in the correct language depending on which BP is used.

Second is to extend Output Determination Logic

    • Use the BAdI: OutputParameterDetermination to override the output language dynamically.
    • You can implement rules such as:
      • If Ship-to = DE → set output language to German
      • If Ship-to = US → set output language to English
    • Alternatively, you could create a custom field on the address to explicitly store the desired output language and use that in the BAdI logic.

For further reference, consult the links below:

Business Partner in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Output Parameter Determination Extensibility

 

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Cannot Determine Item Category for Sub-Item in Servic...
entry.content:
Hello @Noni 

For service transactions, the item category group SERV is not the correct one. For the combination of transaction type SVO1 and main item category SVB4 (Fixed Price Service Bundle), the item category groups that can be used are:

  • NORM
  • SRVE
  • SRVM
  • SRVP
  • SVST

On service orders, for fixed price service bundles items, you can have the following combinations:

Trans. TypeItem Cat. Gr.Main Itm Cat.Item Cat.Alt. Item Cat.
SVO1NORMSVB4SVR4SVA4/SVS4
SVO1SRVESVB4SVE4 
SVO1SRVMSVB4SVS4 
SVO1SRVPSVB4SVP4SEW4
SVO1SVSTSVB4SVR4SVA4

Therefore, maintain the item category group on the material master data so when it's combined with the main item category, it can determine the item categories of the child items.

This documentation can also be helpful: Service Orders with Fixed Price Service Bundles | SAP Help Portal

Kind regards,
Luiza.

entry.title: Re: ABAP Prog to create 2 sheets/tabs in ONE MS excel wor...

entry.title: Re: Manually Adding Employees to Compensation (Duplicates)
entry.content:
@Rodrigo_Lopes 

As far as I know there is nothing that can do what you're asking about EXCEPT eligibility rules : if someone is ineligible (say you start from "Nobody is eligible" and that employee wasn't made eligible by the rule, then admins won't be able to add this person manually to worksheets at all). But if you update your eligibility rules to include this person, then run an Update all worksheets to have this person added automatically by the job (because they are now eligible) nothing will then prevent an admin to add them a second time.

Admins need to check what they are doing by opening the worksheet before they add someone. 

All the best

Xavier

entry.title: Re: S4hana collective production order sent partially to MES
entry.content:
Hello @nerevar 

Thank you for your detailed description and the payload example.

In the SAP S/4HANA Public Edition, the current standard behaviour of the integration scenario SAP_COM_0522 – Manufacturing Order, send (Version 2) is as follows:

Only individual production/manufacturing orders are transferred via the API.

    • When you release a collective order structure, the system automatically releases both the superior (parent) and subordinate (child) orders within S/4HANA.
    • However, only the child orders are distributed to MES via the standard interface. The parent (collective) order header is not sent because collective orders in Public Cloud are handled as internal logistical/settlement structures, not as executable shop floor orders.

Relationship information is not provided in the payload.

    • The current outbound service does not include the collective order hierarchy (parent–child link).
    • What you observed in your payload is correct: only the child order is passed with its own operations, components, and statuses.

This is a standard limitation in Public Cloud.

    • Unlike in On-Premise or Private Cloud, where BAdIs exist to enrich the message with collective order links, in Public Cloud, this enhancement option is not available.
    • The MES integration guide for SAP_COM_0522 explicitly notes that each order is sent as a standalone entity, and collective order references are not part of the outbound interface.

Recommended approaches:

  • Deriving it from S/4HANA via an additional CDS View or released API (e.g., Manufacturing Order – Read service), or
  • Managing the parent–child relationship purely inside S/4HANA and interfacing only the executable child orders to MES.
    • If your MES requires the relationship, you will need to replicate this logic outside the standard API by either:
    • This aligns with SAP’s recommendation: in Public Cloud, MES receives only executable child orders that are to be scheduled and confirmed on the shop floor

Manufacturing Order – Send (Version 2)-SAP Help

Answer to your questions:

  • No, the parent order is not sent later under other conditions. This is not a timing issue but by design.
  • You are not missing a configuration, this is a standard restriction.

Conclusion:
Only child (executable) orders of a collective structure are sent via SAP_COM_0522 to MES in Public Cloud. The parent order and relationship elements are not included in the payload.

Kind regards,
Chuma

entry.title: How to trigger emails for credit note approval requests
entry.content:
Hi

We are working on the credit note approval process.

Credit note type - CR 

The workflow is working fine.
But we have a requirement to send the mail to the approver while raising the credit notes.For this, we created a custom template by copying the standard one in the Maintain Email Templates app.

And we created a workflow in the Manage Sales Document Workflows app.

Please advise how to assign the sender, receiver mail IDs, and form template.

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: E: Error converting to time stamp (In /N/SCWM/RFUI)
entry.content:
Hello @YVARAJA 

Thank you for raising the issue regarding. I have reviewed your querry and have summarised the notable key points below.

First is the root cause analysis:

  • The error you mentioned typically appears when there is a mismatch in date or time formats between the inbound delivery data, user defaults, and the RFUI program expectations.
  • Although your user defaults (SU3) are set to mm/dd/yyyy with 24-hour format, the RFUI process and inbound delivery always rely on the internal SAP timestamp format (YYYYMMDD HHMMSS). Which means any inconsistency in date format, time zone, or missing delivery data can trigger this conversion error.

To localise and solve the issue, below are checks you should Perform

  1. For the user Parameters, verify that your user date/time format is aligned with SAP’s safe defaults:
    • Date: YYYY.MM.DD or DD.MM.YYYY depending on your region.
    • Time: 24-hour.
  2. Ensure time zone consistency. Check your user profile time zone against the warehouse time zone. Misaligned time zones between inbound delivery and RFUI can cause timestamp errors.
  3. Inbound Delivery Data
    • Review the inbound delivery in VL33N/VL32N by ensuring delivery dates and times are valid and complete. Also confirm that there are no blank or corrupted timestamp values.
  4. Test the RFUI inbound HU receiving with another IBD. If the error only occurs for specific documents, it may be related to inconsistent delivery data.
  5. If your system version matches, an SAP incident under component SCM-EWM-RF may be required to solve the issue for you.

 

To summarise, the error arises due to a date/time conversion inconsistency. It is most often resolved by ensuring correct user format settings, time zone alignment, and valid delivery timestamps. If the checks do not resolve the issue, SAP Support will need to investigate further.

The following reference documentation will provide more details.

SAP Best Practices for Embedded EWM

RFUI: Inbound HU Receiving

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Shippeo Real-Time Visibility for SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace: An SAP Endorsed App
entry.content:
Shippeo's real-time transportation visibility data-as-a-service is now an SAP Endorsed App available on SAP Store for integration with the SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace solution (press release: English, Français, Deutsch).  This advancement provides SAP customers with real-time shipment execution data to support supply chain predictability, resilience, and sustainability, reassured by Shippeo’s leadership in data quality when it comes to tracking completeness and ETA accuracy.

This offering extends the reach of SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace by providing multimodal visibility for shipments with data from Shippeo's global network that connects with over 228,000 carriers and 1,100 TMS, WMS, telematics, and ELD systems, covering road, ocean, and parcel transportation.

What does this mean for your business?  

Simplicity in gaining just the high-quality visibility data that you need. 

  • Real-Time Visibility: The service provides real-time visibility for Full Truck Loads (FTL), Less than Truck Loads (LTL), and ocean containers (FCL, LCL). This includes geolocation updates and actual or geofenced milestones for tracking movements on road or at sea.
  • High Quality Data: Estimated Times of Arrival (ETAs) are generated using predictive AI, adapting to real-time traffic, weather, road conditions, and driver hours of service regulations. Shippeo guarantees high accuracy for road delay predictions, as well as high accuracy and completeness for ocean ETA predictions up to 30 days before arrival.
  • Tracking Completeness: Shippeo commits to high tracking rates for all shipments sent for tracking for road and ocean transportation, and high completeness of ocean container tracking and milestones.  
  • Carrier Integration: Carrier integration is managed by Shippeo, which supports multiple tracking solutions including telematics, TMS, and mobile apps. Shippeo commits to onboarding most carriers within 30 days for telematics and 60 days for TMS integration, once the connection request is received.  The integration of Shippeo’s data-as-a-service into SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace is standardized. 

As an SAP Endorsed App, Shippeo’s solution has completed premium certification by SAP, which includes in-depth testing and assessments. This partnership aims to enhance supply chain resilience and responsiveness for the inbound and outbound logistics of shippers in all industries.

Want to learn more?
Discover how data-as-a-service can transform your supply chain visibility by visiting SAP Store now.  
Learn more about the technical details.

entry.title: Handling unit in SHPCON IDoc ends up in error VLA311
entry.content:

STO - OBD - pick pack and PGI in EWM posted, updates in ERP side as well.
Automatic Inbound delivery gets created with Handling units copied on it.
Initially the status of the HU's will be PSTD after PGi of OBD posting a 68C movement.
When i am trying to post the GR (109) of the Inbound delivery via SHPCON IDOC adding E!EDL37 HU segment system ends up in error VLA311. How to reolve this? Further i wanted to also check if the same handling units can be returned to Sending site in OBD which will create another IBD getting the HU's copied so that the receipt part would be simple

If anyone has the same scenario pls help to guide how this should be handled?

entry.title: Unlocking Shipment Visibility with Shippeo and SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace
entry.content:
The new SAP Endorsed App data-as-a-service offering from Shippeo marks a significant advancement for customers of SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace , providing an easy and straightforward way to acquire shipment tracking data. This partnership provides a streamlined data-as-a-service solution, bringing real-time transportation visibility directly into SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace, enabling you to embed business-critical logistics insights within your SAP landscape

In this article, we will explore how this partnership works, focusing on the roles of each key player involved and the specifics around each mode of transport.
________________________________________

Each Player’s Role in the Ecosystem
SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace serves as a collaborative B2B platform that connects shippers and carriers, enabling efficient transportation management. It integrates seamlessly with SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management and LE-TRA, supporting the complete shipment execution process. Carriers can onboard directly into SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace or work through a visibility provider such as Shippeo.  See this post for more about the value to your business.  

Using Shippeo as a visibility provider simplifies onboarding and easily scales by replacing complex peer-to-peer connections with a scalable, one-to-many network. Shippers gain instant access to multiple carriers through a single platform, while carriers only need one integration with Shippeo to collaborate across many shipments and customers.

Let’s examine the roles of each participant in this ecosystem:

SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management and LE-TRA act as the backend systems responsible for processing sales or purchase orders related to shipments. These systems are responsible for shipment planning, execution, and data management, providing the foundational information needed for transportation activities.

SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace handles the tracking of planned versus actual freight order execution. It provides status reporting as well as impact analysis by correlating individual shipment events to specific deliveries or orders. On top of that the platform incorporates embedded logic for event-driven notifications, for example to inform stakeholders about delays.
Shippeo initializes tracking with carriers, processes milestones and exceptions, and calculates both ETAs and ETDs using predictive analytics. It can also provide data on carbon emissions enriching the shipment data with business-relevant insights.
Carriers supply real-time location data through GPS devices installed on vehicles, vessels, or containers or share milestone updates.
________________________________________

Scenarios
Multimodal transport scenarios are supported, accommodating different modes of transportation with mode-specific tracking approaches. Here, we focus on how Shippeo interacts with carriers after a tracking request is initiated from SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace for various transport modes.

Road Transportation
Support for road transport includes Full Truck Loads (FTL) and Less-than-Truck Loads (LTL) carried out across the globe. Shippeo employs a hierarchical approach to initialize tracking based on available identifiers. This includes integration with carrier systems or with delegated fleet, direct ELD telematics or manual tracking input via mobile app or the Shippeo Web portal.

For FTL shipments, real-time location updates are received from carriers through GPS, telematics, or smartphone applications. The system enriches these updates with geo-fencing and localized traffic or weather data, allowing dynamic, predictive ETAs that respond to real-time road conditions and driver hours of service regulations. Additionally, carbon emissions are measured in accordance with the GLEC (Global Logistics Emissions Council) protocol, providing sustainability insights.

LTL shipments benefit from milestone updates and associated emissions data, enabling shippers to track progress at key points and evaluate environmental impact.

Ocean Freight
Ocean shipments—whether port-to-port or inland—are supported through a combination of web scraping and direct carrier integrations. These tracking methods utilize container identifiers such as the Container ID, SCAC (Standard Carrier Alpha Code), and booking references like the Master Bill of Lading (MBL) or EDI messages such as LOA (Letter of Authorization, EDI 315).

The integration hierarchy starts with Shippeo extracting status information via web scraping and progresses to direct container and vessel tracking using the carrier’s connected systems. Container GPS updates are generated approximately every six hours, providing timely position information, while vessel locations and ETAs are updated with similar frequency. Shippeo also delivers container milestone updates shortly after they occur, alongside carbon emissions data at shipment closure.

________________________________________

Conclusion
The partnership between SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace and Shippeo simplifies carrier onboarding and provides enriched, real-time tracking data within the SAP ecosystem. The new Shippeo Endorsed App data-as-a-service empowers businesses to make smarter, timelier logistics decisions.

To learn more, visit the Shippeo press release (English, Français, Deutsch) and explore the SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace product page. This collaboration exemplifies SAP's commitment to delivering smarter, more transparent supply chains—enabling your organization to stay ahead in today’s complex logistics environment.

________________________________________
For questions or further discussions, feel free to leave a comment below!

entry.title: Re: E: Error converting to time stamp (In /N/SCWM/RFUI)
entry.content:
Some of the root causes could be

  • even if the format is mm/dd/yyyy, hidden characters can cause parsing failures. Your user profile settings may show the correct format, but, if the system time zone is different, then, you will have this issue.
  • Coming to RFUI transactions, it rely on precise time stamp. If your inbound delivery has a date & time that is not converted properly, then, you will have this issue.
  • Finally and most importantly, if one of the HU has incorrect date/time format, it will affect the entire delivery.

Also, see whether you need to carry out code corrections as recommended in SAP note 2090154

entry.title: It is not possible to verify credit in BP of different Segments
entry.content: When verifying credit in a BP with different segments, the BP"s original segment is not considered. A message is displayed indicating that the BP has no data in the segment. The relationship between the BPs is FUKM001.

entry.title: Re: Which GID for sapsys I should enter if central instan...
entry.content:
If you want to install another Application Server (also known as a Additional Application Server - AAS), you should use the same SID as the ASCS/PAS.  The instance number could be anyone because it's a new server, but the recommendation is to use a different one from the already used ones.  

This document is valid for S/4HANA, but doesn't differ much from a traditional ERP: https://learning.sap.com/courses/technical-implementation-and-operation-ii-of-sap-s-4hana-and-sap-business-suite/installing-an-aas

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere: OData Connector for PowerBi
entry.content:
hello,

we tested this and the problem is that the token expires and it needs a manual authentication through browser.

in july 2025 SAP release a new Oauth 2.0 client purpose called "Tecnical User".

this technical user have an expire time window up to 20 years.

Basically the authentication is with Client ID, client secret and user name (not password).

The problem is that even if authenticated it can not read Odata from views and analytic models, but this is only a soft limit set up by SAP.

I open an improvement request to unlock this functionality.

please feel free to upvote.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/355555

entry.title: Leveraging SAP Reference Architecture for Event-Driven Application in Missing Part Fulfilment Busine
entry.content:
Introduction

In the era of Industry 4.0, the ability to respond to real-time events in industrial production is crucial for operational efficiency. This blog outlines a proof of concept (PoC) that demonstrates how Airbus leveraged SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), and Events-to-Business Actions Framework to automate and orchestrate the missing part fulfillment process within production operations. The solution leverages an event-driven architecture to automate business processes based on missing part fulfillment in real-time.

This architecture is highly repeatable and can be applied to a wide range of SAP scenarios such as plant maintenance, purchase requisitions, inventory updates, and more, making it a valuable reference for enterprises looking to scale event-driven integrations. 

Engagement

The outcome described in this article was facilitated by custom adaptation of the Events-to-Business-Actions Framework by Airbus and was supported by SAP OCTO Team under PVN Pavankumar

Business Scenario : Missing Part Fulfilment in Production

The use case centres on streamlining the missing part fulfilment process within Airbus production operations. It begins when a missing part is detected for a work order reservation in the SAP ECC backend, which supports day-to-day production activities. From that initial identification, the process continues all the way through to the confirmation of the work order operation.

Throughout this journey, the workflow leverages an event-driven architecture (EDA) to track progress in real time, integrating seamlessly with backend systems. SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) orchestrates collaboration between all involved actors by sending out forms and notifications, gathering approvals, and automating decisions based on predefined business rules. Additionally, the PoC highlights the real-time monitoring and dashboarding features of SAP Build Process Automation, ensuring end-to-end visibility across the process.

This PoC showcases how we made that happen. 

Solution Architecture

Below is the architecture diagram representing the technical landscape for the missing part fulfilment process.

Figure 1: End-to-end architecture of the Airbus missing part fulfillment solution using SAP BTP, Advanced Event Mesh, E2B Framework, and custom Node.js applications.

Technical Implementation 

This architecture leverages key components across SAP BTP, Advanced Event Mesh, and custom applications to create a robust event-to-action pipeline: The Solution Architecture is illustrated in Figure 1, and the important components along with their connectivity are explained below:

-> Business events are triggered:
Different actors interact with the SAP backend (supporting production operations). Transactions such as work order reservations, purchase orders, or outbound deliveries generate relevant business events.

-> Events are routed to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh (AEM):
These events are sent to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh—either directly or via Solace event brokers in Airbus Private Cloud, especially if events need to be shared with other platforms.

->  Event-specific queues manage the flow:
Within SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh, specific queues collect events related to predefined topics, pushing them into the Events to Business Actions (E2B) framework.

->  Business logic and workflows are triggered:
E2B calls SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) APIs to:

  • Apply decision rules and determine what business action should occur based on the event payload,
  • Launch new workflow instances,
  • Update waiting tasks on running workflows,
  • Push events to visibility scenarios for process monitoring.

->  Backend queries for richer context:
E2B also calls backend APIs to fetch more information related to business objects—such as:

  • Details of a reservation linked to a purchase order,
  • The specific station tied to a work order reservation,
  • The list of actors involved, leveraging Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA based on attributes like station.

->  Traceability with PartsNow:
PartsNow, is a custom SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP,Node.js) application, used to persist the relationship between workflow instance IDs and related work order reservation IDs. E2B registers new workflow instances and can retrieve instance details as needed via PartsNow APIs.

->  Unified user experience in SAP Build Workzone:
SAP Build Workzone serves as the entry point for business actors, providing:

  • My Inbox: For completing tasks such as form fills or approvals,
  • My Processes: For real-time workflow monitoring,
  • Process Visibility Dashboard: To track KPIs and process efficiency,
  • Studio Home: Where process specialists can manage BPA decision rules.

->  Automated notifications and integration points:
Finally, SAP BPA calls remote APIs to:

  • Inform the PartsNow app about workflow instance completion,
  • Send email notifications to relevant actors via an SMTP server.

 

Developer Insights

As a developer building this PoC, a few key learnings stand out:

  • Loose coupling using SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh and queues ensures resiliency and scalability.
  • Decision capability in SAP Build Process Automation allowed us to externalize complex logic from the app code, making it easier to maintain and extend.
  • Using SAP BTP Destinations and Service Bindings helped standardize secure backend access across environments.

Deployment Steps

Follow this GitHub documentation for detailed steps for configuration and deployment.

 

Closing Remarks

We hope this blog has inspired new ideas for applying event-driven automation to your own business processes.

Refer to SAP Architecture Centre and Events-to-Business-Actions Framework Repository for implementation details. 

Thanks to colleagues from SAP OCTO Team Praveen Kumar Padegal and Swati Maste for their support.

entry.title: Re: It is not possible to verify credit in BP of differen...
entry.content:
Check the following: -

  • whether you have full authorization which can be done via su53.
  • whether parent BP has credit data maintained for the relevant segment in UKM_BP.
  • Verify the relationship for FUKM001 which should be from parent to child; and similarly, for TUKM001 from child to parent

entry.title: Re: Full Payment Submission Amendment reversal
entry.content:
Hello @Plamo 

Thank you for your question.

To correct an FPSA (Full Payment Submission Adjustment) sent with the wrong payroll period, especially when it concerns a Class 1A termination payment, the recommended approach for UK HMRC RTI reporting using SAP or similar payroll systems is as follows:

  1. Reverse the Incorrect FPSA by submitting a new FPSA for the same payroll period as the incorrect submission but enter the Class 1A value as a negative amount to reverse the original entry. This will offset the previously submitted amount and signal to HMRC that you are amending the record for that period.
  2. Then, submit the FPSA with the correct payroll period and the correct positive Class 1A value for the termination payment. Ensure that all other details on the resubmitted FPSA match the intended correct values.
  3. If the correction involves a previous payroll period or a late submission, select H correction to earlier submission as the reason for late reporting in your FPS submission. This is usually a drop-down or a field in the SAP upload template. You do not need to use an X in the template for reversal. Current RTI does not support that EYU marker. Corrections are handled via the negative value in the FPS and late reason.
  4. HMRC systems use year-to-date figures as authoritative, so your amended FPSA should correctly reflect cumulative totals after the reversal and correction.

Payroll Processing with the Payroll for the United Kingdom Solution

I hope this provides the neccessary insights. Happy to answer any further question.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Content Repository Migration in mind ?
entry.content:
I needed to use report ZMIGRATE_ARCHIVELINK_FILES_ENH of oss note 1043676 - Migration of ArchiveLink Documents

To move contents from our old content server over to a new one  somewhere around 820.000 documents.

The report did the work correctly, but there is a problem with temp files the report puts in directory DIR_GLOBAL
i.e. on my system /usr/sap/IPP/SYS/global/

Those files are NOT deleted after use an pile up on the app server until the disk space is filled up.

To get around this I had to modify the code from https://me.sap.com/notes/1043676

"modified main form
form main.
* get docids to be processed
  perform get_docids using old_arc changing docs.
  perform get_pl_docids using old_arc changing docs.

* remove duplicates to process each document only once
  sort docs by doc_id doc_type.
  delete adjacent duplicates from docs.
  write: / 'FOUND ', lines( docs ), 'ITEMS'.
  if max_coun gt 0.
    write : ' LIMITED TO ', max_coun.
  endif.
  uline.

  data(lv_counter) = 0.
  loop at docs into doc.
    add 1 to lv_counter.
    clear new_doc_id.
* get current document status
    perform check_status using old_arc doc-doc_id changing status doc_type.
    if test_run ne 'X'.
* Check the status of the document and start the copying process
      if status = 'ONLINE'.
        perform copy_doc
          using old_arc doc-doc_id doc-doc_type test_run
          changing new_arc new_doc_id.
        if not new_doc_id is initial.
*     update all effected connections
          perform update_connections using old_arc doc-doc_id new_arc
          new_doc_id.

          perform update_pl_connections using old_arc doc-doc_id new_arc
          new_doc_id.
        endif.
        commit work.
      endif.
    endif.
    if lv_counter gt 499 and lv_counter mod 500 eq 0.
      perform clean_temp_files using abap_false.
    endif.
    if max_coun gt 0 and lv_counter ge max_coun.
      exit.
    endif.
  endloop.

  if test_run ne 'X'.
    perform clean_temp_files using abap_true.
  endif.
endform.

"New function
form clean_temp_files using uv_clean_all.
  data:
    lv_pvalue    type tpfyvalue-value,
    lv_dir_name  type eps2filnam,
    lv_file_mask type epsf-epsfilnam,
    lv_fdate     type datum,
    lv_ftime     type uzeit,
    lv_cut_time  type uzeit,
    lt_dir_list  type standard table of eps2fili.

  call function 'SXPG_PROFILE_PARAMETER_GET'
    exporting
      parameter_name  = 'DIR_GLOBAL'
    importing
      parameter_value = lv_pvalue.

  lv_dir_name = |{ lv_pvalue }/|.
  lv_file_mask = |{ sy-sysid case = lower }{ sy-mandt }*|.
  call function 'EPS2_GET_DIRECTORY_LISTING'
    exporting
      iv_dir_name            = lv_dir_name
      file_mask              = lv_file_mask
    tables
      dir_list               = lt_dir_list
    exceptions
      invalid_eps_subdir     = 1
      sapgparam_failed       = 2
      build_directory_failed = 3
      no_authorization       = 4
      read_directory_failed  = 5
      too_many_read_errors   = 6
      empty_directory_list   = 7
      others                 = 8.
  if sy-subrc eq 0.
    " 26.05.2025 14:03:03
    if uv_clean_all is not initial.
      lv_cut_time = sy-uzeit.
    else.
      lv_cut_time = sy-uzeit - 1800.
    endif.
    write : / |Delete from: { lv_dir_name } Older than: { sy-datum } { lv_cut_time }|.
    loop at lt_dir_list into data(ls_file).
      concatenate ls_file-mtim+6(4) ls_file-mtim+3(2) ls_file-mtim(2) into lv_fdate.
      concatenate ls_file-mtim+11(2) ls_file-mtim+14(2) ls_file-mtim+17(2) into lv_ftime.

      if ( lv_fdate lt sy-datum ) or ( lv_fdate eq sy-datum and lv_ftime lt lv_cut_time ).
        call function 'EPS_DELETE_FILE'
          exporting
            iv_long_file_name      = conv eps2filnam( ls_file-name )
            dir_name               = conv epsf-epsdirnam( lv_dir_name )
          exceptions
            invalid_eps_subdir     = 1
            sapgparam_failed       = 2
            build_directory_failed = 3
            no_authorization       = 4
            build_path_failed      = 5
            delete_failed          = 6
            others                 = 7.
        if sy-subrc eq 0.
          write : / |Delete temp file: { ls_file-name } { ls_file-mtim }|.
        else.
          write : / |Failed to delete file: { ls_file-name } { ls_file-mtim }|.
        endif.

      endif.

    endloop.
  endif.

endform.

entry.title: Re: Feed SAP Help, UI5 APIs & SAP Community Content into your AI with this Open Source MCP Serve
entry.content:
Hi @Marian_Zeis 

This solution is fantastic.

Until now, whenever I needed "help" on some new topic, I downloaded full sections from sap help, uploaded them to Claude and started making questions. I'll try your solution ASAP.

By any chance you have Tutorial, video or post providing a brief overview about how to create the MCP Server and most of all, how to feed it with specific documentation? Nothing fancy, just a brief guidance would be enough.  I've been working in SAP during the last 19 years (ABAP, Workflow, Fiori and RAP). I always document all the things I learn, but after all these time, it's became a bit difficult to remember where I put certain files I created many years ago. I've been searching for some AI solutions but  haven't found anything useful yet (though I started this research a couple of days ago).

I did some tests with Claude Connectors, but somehow it's now able to find my files in Google Drive. I was planning to try ChatGPT and see if I have better luck.

I'm taking a Data Science Bootcamp, as of now, I'm good at Python and I'm about to complete the Machine Learning Units, though there's still some months pending before I reach the AI, Agents and MCP stuff.

entry.title: Re: Change Output Title In Sales Order Output in S4HC
entry.content:
Hello @kutaysarigul 

Following up on your question, below you will find detailed explanation and the steps you can take to resolve the issue you reported.

Here is why the Issue you reported occur

  • The text “Changed Order” comes from the standard data binding in the delivered form template. Unless that binding is modified, the form will continue to render this text.
  • Adding a new custom field in the form layout does not automatically display in the output unless it is properly bound to the sales order ID in the form context. If left unbound, it remains invisible during runtime.

Below is a recommendation on how you can fix the issue

  1. Open the Form Template and access the Maintain Form Templates app and download the custom template. Then Open it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.
  2. Locate the Bound Field in the Hierarchy tab, find the field currently showing “Changed Order”. Check its binding in the Data View, it is likely connected to a field such as ChangedOrderID.
  3. Update the Binding and Label by rebind the field to the correct element, e.g., SalesOrderID or the field representing the original sales order number. Change the caption text from “Changed Order” to “Order”. This ensures the label shows as required while the correct order number is displayed.
  4. Save and upload the modified template and upload it back into the Maintain Form Templates App. Then test the output by triggering a sales document again.

To summarise, by rebinding the field from ChangedOrderID to the correct order number field and updating the label text to “Order”, you will be able to ensure the output form shows the correct title and number.

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: ABAP Prog to create 2 sheets/tabs in ONE MS excel wor...
entry.content: XCO is absent from ABAP 7.40. Using abap2xlsx would be the cheapest solution but if your client has money to investigate other solutions, you can try a solution like running OLE to create a new sheet via Excel running on the user's laptop. It can't work if you run the program in background. If your client agrees to these limitations, use Excel macro recorder to get the methods and properties to invoke via ABAP OLE statements. Otherwise, you may decode the XLSX or XML format of a two-sheets workbook and see how you can generate this format by program (it's what abap2xlsx does). The last solution is to pay API to generate Excel file (search the Web for software). Maybe your client prefers paying a support over using free software.

entry.title: BRF+ Output Determination for Purchase Order (PO)
entry.content:
BRF+ (Business Rule Framework Plus) is SAP's modern rules engine that allows flexible, business-driven decision-making without requiring deep technical configuration changes. In the context of Output Management for Purchase Orders, BRF+ helps in determining:

  • Which output type (Email, PDF, Print, EDI, XML) to trigger.
  • The format and template (Adobe Forms/ Smartforms).
  • Receiver details (Vendor, Internal Department, multi-party).
  • Conditions for Output (based on Company code, purchasing organisation, vendor, document type, etc.).

This enables procurement teams to control rules dynamically without waiting for technical transports.

🔎 Why BRF+ is Needed

  1. Flexibility & Agility: Business teams can update rules directly (via decision tables) without developer dependency.
  2. Future-Oriented: NACE and classical message determination are considered legacy; SAP S/4 HANA encourages BRF+ adoption for output management.
  3. Centralized Control: All output determination rules across purchasing documents can be managed in one place.
  4. Integration Ready: BRF+ integrates seamlessly with SAP Fiori apps and newer communication channels (EMail, EDI, XML).

Why BRF+ is Better than Classical Output Determination (NACE)

AspectNACE/Classical OutputBRF+ Output Management
FlexibilityLimited to condition technique, complex for multiple condition.Very flexible, supports nested rules, decision tables, and expression.
MaintenanceRequires transport requests, ABAP knowledge, and condition tablesBusiness-driven, editable via decision tables without transports
UISAP GUI-based, less intuitiveFiori-enables, user-friendly
ScalabilityDifficult to extend for new output channelsEasily supports new formats (XML, Email, PDFs)

💡Sample Business Scenario:

A company wants to send Purchase Order Outputs in different ways based on vendor and region:

  • Domestic Vendors (India): Output should be sent as a PDF printout and simultaneously via Email.
  • Overseas Vendors (EU, US): Output should be sent in XML format for EDI integration.
  • Critical Suppliers (Strategic Vendors): A copy should be sent to internal management team via Email for visibility.

👉 With NACE, this setup would require multiple condition records, access sequences, and technical adjustments.

👉With BRF+, business users can simply maintain a decision table with rules like:

Vendor RegionPO ValeVendor TypeOutput TypeReceiver
IndiaAnyNormalPDF + EmailVendor + Management
EUAnyNormalXML (EDI)Vendor

Step 1: Manage Activation of Application Object Type

Path: SPRO > IMG > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Manage Application Object Type Activation

Step 2: Define Output Types

Path: SPRO > IMG > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Define Output Types

Select the line item and navigate to Details

Note: Once these settings are activated, print preview option will be disabled in the Purchase Order Screen.

Step 3: Define Business Rules for Output Parameter Determination

Note: To display the rules in Fiori screen we need to upload standard XML Forms in SAP system, these forms will be imported using BRF+ Transaction code.

If the forms's aren't uploaded, we won't be able to see the output type in the Output Parameter Determination transaction. We can get the details of Form from SAP Note: 2248229.

Click on table Settings

Click on Insert column > From Context Data Objects

Chose the Condition Parameter and click OK

Fill the values for the selected condition parameter

Similarly check for other Determination Steps (Click Activate once after maintaining relevant data in each determination rule) 

Receiver

Channel

Maintain two line items one for Email and other is for Print

Print Settings

Email Settings

Note: If Email template are not available, assign the template by following below steps

SPRO > Cross-Components Application > Output Control > Assign Form Templates

Email Recipient

If no recipient maintained, system will consider the email address from the supplier master data.

If requirement is sending CC or BCC emails, you can change in Email type code as below

Click on Activate and then on Start Simulation

Mention document type value and execute

Create a Purchase Order for Test case

Navigate to messages

Select the print line item and click on display document

Select the line item and click on Send Output, status changed to To be Output

Go back and save the PO, status will change to Completed.

 

If you found this guide helpful, don’t miss my other SAP MM WM blogs covering real-world automation, configuration tips, and best practices for procurement, inventory management, and warehouse management.

Click to view other SAP MM Blogs - SAP Community

 

Thanks & Regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: SAP GUI version 800 compatibility with Windows 11
entry.content:
Is SAP GUI 800 compatible with Windows 11?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI version 800 compatibility with Windows 11
entry.content:
Hello,

Please refer to https://me.sap.com/notes/66971/E

Supported platforms for SAP GUI for Windows

  • SAP GUI for Windows 8.00:
    • Windows 10 32-bit (only Education, Pro, and Enterprise editions)
    • Windows 10 64-bit on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T (only Education, Pro, and Enterprise editions)
    • Windows Server 2016 64-bit on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T
    • Windows Server 2019 64-bit on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T
    • Windows 11 on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T (only Education, Pro, and Enterprise editions)
    • Windows Server 2022 on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T:
    • Windows Server 2025 on x64 (AMD) and Intel EM64T - as of patch level 11

entry.title: New Quick Start Guides and Resources for Our Academic Community
entry.content:
We are excited to share important updates that will help you and your students get the most out of SAP University Alliances teaching resources!

 

What’s New:

We’ve just released two new Quick Start Guides designed to help you get started right away:

 

SAP Business Data Cloud –  a complete Software-as-a-Service solution for data and analytics, deeply integrated across SAP applications, and delivers intelligent applications and curated data products across all lines of business.

 

SAP Business Suite – a cloud-native, set of integrated solutions, combining ERP and Line-of Business (LoB) applications that unites data and AI to streamline and optimize companies' enterprise management.

 

As Quick Start Guides, they are short, beginner-friendly slide decks designed for faculty and students. Each guide provides a fast track to understanding, testing, and teaching an SAP solution—without requiring hours of preparation. 

You can access the new guides here:

  • Quick Start Guide: SAP Business Data Cloud
  • Quick Start Guide: SAP Business Suite

     

    Remember: 

    Quick Start Guides are meant to get you started fast. To build on that foundation, we also provide other resources that dive deeper into teaching and learning with SAP. 

     

 

Want to check other SAP University Alliances available resources? Check out our blogpost here.

entry.title: Re: The regular wagetype is getting processed in off-cycl...
entry.content:
If I remember correctly, there is a Processing Class in Table view V_512W_D that relates to Off-Cycle processing.

Check your Wage Type's values, and compare them to a similar WT that is processed correctly (table view C_512W_O is useful for comparisons).

entry.title: Error creating transport request ERP public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Community!

I attempted to create a new, transportable package outside of the ZLOCAL component. However, the system still produces an error when I try to create the transportation.

I suspect the root cause may not be just the package type, but the extension methodology itself. My understanding is that for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, classic extensions (like creating an ENHO object from Eclipse) are not permitted in order to maintain a "Clean Core." Instead, the recommended approach is to use the "Custom Logic" Fiori app to implement BAdIs that SAP has explicitly released for the cloud.

 

My specific question is: Is the BADI_WHT BAdI enabled for extension via Eclipse ADT in our public cloud environment, or is it mandatory that we find an alternative, released BAdI within the "Custom Logic" app?

 

I am attaching screenshots of the new error I receive when using the transportable package.

 

I appreciate your guidance in ensuring we are using the correct extensibility method for our platform.

 

Best regards,

 

Diana
I only have ZLOCAL and Z001 for superpackage

more information (my question):
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/error-creating-badi-enhancement-implementation-quot-sap-object-enhs-cannot/qaq-p/14195538 

BaDI: https://api.sap.com/badi/BADI_FIBRREI_WHT
